body_html: test_lrn_default_cpu also consistently fails with core dumped for me (e.g. https://ci.pytorch.org/jenkins/job/caffe2-builds/job/py2-cuda9.0-cudnn7-aten-ubuntu16.04-test/512/console). Should it also be skipped?
body_text: test_lrn_default_cpu also consistently fails with core dumped for me (e.g. https://ci.pytorch.org/jenkins/job/caffe2-builds/job/py2-cuda9.0-cudnn7-aten-ubuntu16.04-test/512/console). Should it also be skipped?
body: `test_lrn_default_cpu` also consistently fails with `core dumped` for me (e.g. https://ci.pytorch.org/jenkins/job/caffe2-builds/job/py2-cuda9.0-cudnn7-aten-ubuntu16.04-test/512/console). Should it also be skipped?
